source: 211.org Network, Florida Department of Veterans' Affairs, Bay Area Legal Services, VOA Florida

resources.name: Florida Veterans Support Line (MYFLVET)
resources.description: Free, confidential 24/7 support line providing emotional support and connections to VA and non-VA community resources for veterans in crisis or transitioning to civilian life

resources.name: Florida 211 Helpline
resources.description: 24/7 free resource connecting people to social services including food, housing, utilities, health care, mental health, employment, and disaster assistance with veteran-specific services available

resources.name: Volunteers of America Florida (VOA Florida)
resources.address: 850 5th Ave South Suite 1100, St. Petersburg, FL 33701
resources.description: Largest provider of supportive housing for veterans in Florida, serving 19 communities from Pensacola to Key West. Operates veterans villages and provides comprehensive support services

resources.name: Florida Department of Veterans' Affairs - State Veterans' Service Officers
resources.description: Network of ~100 State Veterans' Service Officers providing free benefits assistance, claims help, and access to FDVA programs. Officers stationed at VA Regional Office, VA Medical Centers, and VA Outpatient Clinics

resources.name: Hope Navigators - Florida Department of Veterans' Affairs
resources.description: First-line contact program with trained navigators who are often veterans themselves, helping connect to state benefits and services

resources.name: Florida Veterans Legal Helpline
resources.address: Served by Bay Area Legal Services
resources.description: Free legal advice and representation for eligible Florida veterans. Operated by Major General Ernest A. and Marilyn Bedke Veterans Law Center through Bay Area Legal Services

resources.name: First Contact - 211 Tampa Bay Cares (SSVF Program)
resources.address: Serves 8 counties in Tampa Bay area
resources.description: Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF) program rapidly housing veterans and families experiencing homelessness and prevents homelessness for at-risk veterans

resources.name: 211 Big Bend - Florida Veterans Support Line
resources.description: Regional 211 center partnering with Florida Department of Veterans' Affairs and Crisis Center of Tampa Bay to provide emotional support and resource connections for veterans

resources.name: Employ Florida Vets
resources.description: State's online jobs portal providing employment services to Florida veterans, matching service members to jobs and training opportunities suited to military skills and experience

resources.name: Veterans Florida
resources.description: Non-profit corporation created by State of Florida to attract and retain veterans and their families by connecting to employment, training, educational opportunities, and strengthening veteran recruitment

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: VA-staffed 24/7 call center serving homeless veterans, at-risk veterans, and their families with linkages to VA and community-based resources

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: Free, confidential service providing trained responders 24/7 for veterans in crisis, available via phone and text

resources.name: CareerSource Pasco Hernando (Veteran Employment Services)
resources.address: 4438 Grand Boulevard, New Port Richey, FL 34652
resources.description: Regional career center providing employment services specifically for veterans including job training, placement, and workforce development

resources.name: Operation Sacred Trust (Broward & Miami-Dade Housing)
resources.address: Barbara Carey-Shuler Manor, 1400 NW 54th Street, Miami, FL 33142
resources.description: Supportive housing and services for veterans and families experiencing homelessness in Miami-Dade and Broward counties. Part of SSVF program with transportation assistance available

resources.name: Windmoor Healthcare - Veteran Mental Health Program
resources.description: Specialized inpatient mental health and substance abuse treatment for veterans. 24/7 admission assessments. Veteran liaison available

resources.name: Recovery First - Veteran Addiction Treatment
resources.description: Evidence-based addiction and co-occurring disorder treatment specifically for veterans and first responders struggling with substance abuse and PTSD

resources.name: Broward Legal Aid - Mission United Veterans Project
resources.description: Free legal services for eligible veterans in Broward County including benefits claims, family law, housing, and other legal issues

resources.name: Legal Aid Society of Orange County - VALOR Project
resources.description: Free legal services for eligible veterans in Orange County through the VALOR veterans legal project

resources.name: Three Rivers Legal Services (North Central Florida)
resources.address: 1000 NE 16th Ave, Building I, Gainesville, FL 32601
resources.description: Legal services for low-income residents including veterans in north central Florida region

resources.name: Legal Aid Society of Palm Beach County
resources.description: Free legal services for eligible veterans and low-income residents in Palm Beach County

resources.name: Feeding South Florida
resources.description: Major food bank serving South Florida with network of food pantries available to veterans and low-income families

resources.name: Feeding Tampa Bay
resources.description: Major food bank serving Tampa Bay area with extensive network of food pantries and meal programs

resources.name: Feeding Northeast Florida
resources.description: Food bank serving Northeast Florida with multiple pantry locations throughout the region

resources.name: National Veterans Homeless Support (NVHS) - Central Florida
resources.description: Prevents homelessness for veterans in Central Florida through emergency assistance, housing support, and resource connections

resources.name: Florida Veterans Foundation - Referral Services
resources.description: Non-profit organization providing veteran referral services and resource center assistance for connecting veterans to appropriate programs
